Event.name: Telling
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> addresses an <fen>Addressee</fen> with a <fen>Message</fen>, which may be indirectly referred to as a <fen>Topic</fen>. Instead of (or in addition to) a <fen>Speaker</fen>, a <fen>Medium</fen> may also be mentioned.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> <t>told</t> <fex name="Addressee">him</fex> <fex name="Topic">about the party</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speaker
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex><fex name="Speaker">Bill</fex> <t>told</t> me that he would come to the party.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Message
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>. <ex>The authorities <t>informed</t> me <fex name="Message">that my brother had been arrested</fex>.</ex> <ex>I <t>told</t> him <fex name="Message">a bedtime story</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>Leroy <t>told</t> his mother <fex name="Topic">about his arrest</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes the way in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> describes the way the <fen>Speaker</fen> accomplishes the task of giving the <fen>Addressee</fen> the <fen>Message</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex>Even when we had a size problem they <t>informed</t> me <fex name="Time">right away</fex> and everything worked out great.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex>She looked at it for a few moments, thinking of Mark Smeaton and what he had <t>told</t> her <fex name="Place">on the steps of City Hall</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Communicative_force
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the <fex name="Cf">Communicative_force</fex> or authority with which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed. This FE is often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.
<ex>She has yet to <m>receive</m> <fex name="Cf">official</fex> <t>notification</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Descriptor
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a characteristic or description of the telling event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: inform.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give facts or information to

lexUnit.name: assure.v

lexUnit.name: confide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tell someone about a secret or private matter in confidence

lexUnit.name: notify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: inform, typically in a formal or official manner.

lexUnit.name: notification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: notifying, informing, typically in a formal or official manner

lexUnit.name: assurance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a positive declaration intended to give confidence

lexUnit.name: let know.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: tell (someone) by language or some other means.
